Data.event_text: Ukraine halts the transportation of Russian gas supplies through the country, following the expiration of a five-year transit deal.

links.text: -"Russian gas supply to Europe via Ukraine halted after transit deal expires". Al Jazeera. 1 January 2025. Retrieved 1 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: Ukraine becomes a state party in the International Criminal Court.

links.text: -"Ukraine becomes ICC member state". Ukrinform. 2025-01-01. Retrieved 2025-01-01.-

Data.event_text: 11 January  Ukraine announces the capture of two North Korean soldiers during fighting in Russia's Kursk Oblast.

links.text: -"Ukraine says it captured two North Korean soldiers in Russia's Kursk". Al Jazeera. 11 January 2025. Retrieved 12 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 16 January  Ukraine and the United Kingdom sign a 100-year partnership agreement.

links.text: -"UK leader Starmer signs '100-year partnership' agreement with Ukraine during trip to Kyiv". AP News. Retrieved 18 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 21 January  Ukraine and Albania sign a 10-year bilateral security agreement.

links.text: -"Ukraine and Albania sign agreement on long-term cooperation and support". RBC-Ukraine. Retrieved 2025-01-22.-

Data.event_text: The head of the Security Service of Ukraine's counter-terrorism department is arrested on suspicion of working for Russia since 2018.

links.text: -Greenall, Robert (2025-02-12). "Senior Ukraine security figure exposed as Russian 'rat'". BBC. Retrieved 2025-02-12.-

Data.event_text: US president Donald Trump announces the beginning of negotiations with Russia to end the war in Ukraine following a phone call with Russian president Vladimir Putin.

links.text: -"Ukraine war talks start now, Trump says after Putin call". BBC. 13 February 2025. Retrieved 13 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 13 February  President Zelenskyy imposes sanctions on multiple oligarchs and individuals including former president Petro Poroshenko, Viktor Medvedchuk, Kostyantyn Zhevago, Ihor Kolomoisky and Hennadiy Boholyubov on suspicion of "high treason" and assisting a terrorist organization, particularly their role in compromising national security through unfavorable business agreements with Russia.

links.text: -Jochecova, Ketrin; Melkozerova, Veronika (13 February 2025). "Tensions erupt in Ukraine as Zelenskyy sanctions former leader Poroshenko". Politico. Retrieved 13 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 28 February  A diplomatic row breaks out between President Zelenskyy and US President Donald Trump during their meeting at the White House, resulting in the failure to sign the UkraineUnited States Mineral Resources Agreement.

links.text: -Cone, Allen; Godfrey, Paul (2025-02-28). "Trump breaks off mineral talks with Ukraine, calls Zelensky 'disrespectful' in shouting match". United Press International. Retrieved 2025-03-01.-
-Kramer, Andrew E.; Varenikova, Maria; MÃ©heut, Constant (2025-02-28). "The U.S.-Ukraine Mineral Deal Is Now In Peril: What We Know". The New York Times. Retrieved 2025-03-01.-

Data.event_text: 3 March  The United States suspends all military aid to Ukraine.

links.text: -Liptak, Kevin; Waldenberg, Samantha; Liebermann, Oren (2025-03-03). "Trump pauses military aid to Ukraine after Oval Office argument with Zelensky, White House official says". CNN. Retrieved 2025-03-04.-

Data.event_text: 5 March  The United States suspends intelligence sharing with Ukraine.

links.text: -"The CIA director confirmed that the US has paused the supply of intelligence data to Ukraine - media". UNN. 2025-03-05. Retrieved 2025-03-05.-

Data.event_text: 12 March  After talks between US and Ukrainian officials in Saudi Arabia, the United States resumes military aid and intelligence sharing with Ukraine as well as intelligence support.

links.text: -MATTHEW LEE (2025-03-12). "US resumes military aid and intelligence sharing as Ukraine says it is open to a 30-day ceasefire". Associated Press. Retrieved 2025-03-12.-

Data.event_text: The European Court of Human Rights rules that the Ukrainian government failed to prevent and adequately investigate the 2014 Odesa clashes and orders it to pay compensation.

links.text: -Martin Fornusek (2025-03-13). "ECHR rules Ukraine failed to prevent, investigate violence in Odesa in 2014". The Kyiv Independent. Retrieved 2025-03-13.-

Data.event_text: The former leader of the Right Sector's Odesa branch, Demyan Hanul, is shot dead in Odesa.

links.text: -Zadorozhnyy, Tim (14 March 2025). "Ukrainian activist Demyan Hanul shot dead in central Odesa". The Kyiv Independent. Retrieved 14 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: 16 March  The Ukrainian military confirms its withdrawal from Sudzha, Kursk Oblast.

links.text: -"Ukraine confirms withdrawal from Sudzha in Russia's Kursk Oblast". The Kyiv Independent. 16 March 2025. Retrieved 20 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: 17 March  President Zelenskyy signs a law allowing the Armed Forces of Ukraine to operate overseas in times of martial law.

links.text: -Tim Zadorozhnyy (2025-03-17). "Zelensky signs law permitting Ukrainian troops to operate abroad during martial law". The Kyiv Independent. Retrieved 2025-03-20.-

Data.event_text: 28 March  Oleksandr Plakhotnik, the former deputy mayor of Kamianske, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast is found shot dead in the city.

links.text: -Kateryna Denisova (2025-03-29). "Ukrainian politician shot dead in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, media report". The Kyiv Independent. Retrieved 2025-03-29.-
